intro: Bidens perianthomega, commonly known as the yellow ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has palmately lobed leaves and produces seeds with pappus structures that aid in wind dispersal. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soils, often found in prairies and open woodlands. Botanically, it belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers.
